intro: Sabatia brachiata, commonly known as the branched sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and typically grows in sandy or disturbed soils. The plant features delicate, branching stems and small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually narrow and alternate along the stem, and it often thrives in open, sunny habitats. Sabatia brachiata is adapted to coastal and dune environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
